com.ibm.xmi.framework
Class XMIDTD

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.xmi.framework.XMIDTD
public class XMIDTD
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an XMI DTD. You can write framework packages and classes to the DTD.

You can create either XMI 1.0 or XMI 1.1 DTDs. The default is XMI 1.0, but you can call the setXMIVersion method to set the version to 1.1 before calling the write method.

Currently the only option that is supported when writing is the defualt option, but there may be other options in the future.

If you are writing an XMI 1.0 DTD, namespaces are ignored, but they are used if you write an XMI 1.1 DTD.

The default XML encoding is UTF-8, but you can change it to any encoding supported by XML4J version 2.0.15.

write

public void write(java.util.Iterator declarations)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Write the declarations (classes and packages) to the file. The classes and packages should be the top level ones. If you put a class or package in the top level collection, and it is contained in another package, it will be written twice.
Parameters:
declarations - The top level classes and packages
